explainers.title: Quantum 101 for Executives
explainers.description: A clear, jargon-free introduction to quantum computing for business leaders.

explainers.title: Understanding Quantum Advantage
explainers.description: What quantum advantage means, when it matters, and why it's not here yet for most use cases.

reports.title: State of Enterprise Quantum Readiness 2024
reports.description: Evidence-based assessment of current quantum computing capabilities and enterprise adoption trends.

reports.title: What Quantum Will Not Solve in 5 Years
reports.description: An honest analysis of quantum computing limitations and realistic timelines for enterprise impact.

glossary.definition: The basic unit of quantum information. Unlike classical bits (0 or 1), qubits can exist in superposition of both states.
The point at which a quantum computer solves a practical problem faster or better than any classical computer.
Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum. Describes current quantum devices with 50-1000 qubits that are error-prone but potentially useful.
An algorithm that combines quantum and classical computing, using each for what it does best.
A quantum computing approach specialized for optimization problems, used by D-Wave systems.
Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm. A hybrid algorithm for combinatorial optimization problems.
Variational Quantum Eigensolver. A hybrid algorithm for finding ground state energies of molecules.
Demonstration that a quantum computer can perform a calculation impossible for classical computers. Not the same as quantum advantage.
